text: in the Syrian town of Tartus they've
taken to the streets to praise the
president russia's President Vladimir
Putin has been hailed as a hero for
supporting President Assad at times it
doesn't look the most spontaneous
outpouring of emotion but the Russian
Defense Ministry that brought us here as
part of a tour assures us this rally
wasn't organized for our cameras
president support like this for six
weeks now Russian bombers have been
taking off round-the-clock from an
airbase near Latakia their mission
airstrikes on what Moscow calls
terrorist targets from the air Russia
has been providing vital support for
President Assad's ground troops
but not everyone in Syria welcomes the
intervention Russia has been accused of
causing civilian casualties with its
airstrikes it denies that some jihadist
groups have declared a holy war on
Russia but Moscow has friends here this
used to be the Latakia sports stadium
it's now a refugee camp for thousands of
Syrians who fled the fighting many of
the people we spoke to here said Russia
has given them hope Mohammad told me
that Russia's military operation is
helping his country after three years
here he hopes to return home soon to
Aleppo so many have been killed in Syria
so many made homeless after more than
four years of war people here just want
their lives back Steve Rosenberg BBC
News Latakia Syria
